p: The Δ G bind values correspond to the sum of interaction energies in the gas phase between the protein and ligand (Δ E MM), the desolvation free energy (Δ G solv), and the system entropy (− TΔ S). Here, Δ E MM is the sum of internal energy (Δ E internal), sum of bond length, angle, and dihedral energies), electrostatic contributions (Δ E electrostatic), and van der Waals terms (Δ E vdW). Δ G solv is the sum of the polar contributions (Δ G GB) and non-polar contributions (Δ G SA). The external dielectric constant of the solute was defined as 80, while the internal dielectric constant was defined as 1. Δ G SA was determined from the solvent accessible surface area (SASA) estimated using the LCPO algorithm. For the free energy calculations, 1,000 MD frames were used, corresponding to the last 5 ns of the simulations.
